result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J Menconi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard J Menconi is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard J Menconi was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 30 days to pay or 32 days KCJ or 32 days work crew.
Deft sentenced to serve 4 days work crew, commencing 3/25/16 @ 8am.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard J Menconi

defendant.name: Menconi, Richard J

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Satisfaction of court order. Completed work crew for mandatory sentence.
Signed up for work crew per judge's order for mandatory sentence.
$1,630.50 due.  Failure to pay, 32 days KCJ or 32 days work crew.  kmk

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Hans Koesser.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 2 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 1 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation waived by parties.  Sentenced to serve 4 days on the work crew commencing 3/25/16 at 8:00 a.m.  Fined $500 + costs (total $1,630.50) due in 30 days or 32 days Co. Jail or 32 days on the work crew.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.

Defendant, Richard J Menconi, appeared with Attorney Hans Peter Koesser.  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 3.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury selection scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphernalia.
  *No Contact w/ Alec B, Vincent O, KCH (6/19/98).
961.41(1)(h)1 Manuf/Deliver THC   /   961.573(1) Poss of Drug Para

151 p.m.   Special Prosecutor Attorney Daniel Tombasco  appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carl Johnson.  Clk  Janell Thwing. Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.  $2500 Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).
and witness list filed by the State

received from deft today @ 3:03pm - unable to report to work crew on 3/25/16 due to holiday.  Work crew instructed him to report on 3/28/16.  Deft reported this morning and was instructed to report back tomorrow to complete his wc sentence.  Deft now calling to inform the court he has school tomorrow.  Clerk contacted deft @ 4:50pm & instructed deft to fax a request to the court to defer his wc sentence to after completion of school.  Deft unable to take fax number down since he had no pen/paper.  Clerk informed him to contact the court tomorrow to obtain the fax number.
